newsitem.title: USA: Canadian natgas prices turn lower on weather.
newsitem.headline: Canadian natgas prices turn lower on weather.

text.p: Canadian natural gas prices turned slightly lower Monday, as injections slowed and more moderate weather weakened demand, market sources said.
At the AECO storage hub, prices fell by five cents to about C$1.77-1.82 per gigajoule (GJ), with the higher-priced deals evident in late morning trade.
Today's forecasts in Calgary are calling for temperature highs of about eight or nine degrees Celsius.
May AECO was talked at C$1.79 per GJ, while May/October pricing was around C$1.75, traders said.
